content: Program Design 2.0 The importance of focusing on personal transformation  Kia ora Shruthi Vijayakumar! Great to hear you’re exploring new ideas in the context of Live The Dream. I’d love to hear more about what’s driving that inquiry — what do you feel is missing from Live The Dream at the moment? I hope u.Lab is going well this year, and you’ve made some good connections? What has been the greatest highlight of the process so far for you? We’ve been working with Theory U for advancing Program Design in the social space for awhile now, to take a deeper dive into the problems, barriers, and personal motivations for doing this kind of work. I’d say Lifehack are leading the field at the moment in NZ, and EXP (cofounded by Silvia Zuur, Billy Matheson & Anthony Cabraal) are doing some exciting work with Theory U in the events space. I’m excited by the idea that more entrepreneurship programs, be they accelerators or incubators, start paying attention to the importance of inner work. Whilst I understand and have often held the tension of needing to ‘build, create and get shit done’, I believe that the important piece for the kind of impact we need to see in the world, is often about personal transformation, bridging into group work. I’d say this is Program Design 2.0 and we need to start looking at evolving it further too. Obviosuly there’s also plenty of Theory U being used in the Social Labs space around the world too — it’s one cornerstone of most practice I’m aware of. So tell us more about what you’re seeking to do with Live The Dream and let’s keep the korero rolling!
